title: kotomine_kirei_(prisma_illya)
body:
The version of [[Kotomine Kirei]] seen in [[Fate/Kaleid Liner Prisma Illya]], specifically from the Miyuverse. Here, the Church has lost its influence, and Kirei works as a ramen shop owner which only sells overpriced [[mapo tofu]].

This Kirei can be distinguished by the blue bandanna, blue apron, and black casual clothes he wears.

title: kotomine_kirei_(businessman)
body:
The version of [[Kotomine Kirei]] seen in [[Fate/Tiger Colosseum]]. In this universe, he loses his memories and is tricked into becoming a businessman. He eventually regains his memories and returns to his former self, confronting the one who caused his amnesia.

This particular Kirei can be distinguished by his combed-back hair and [[glasses]].

title: ball_tongs
body:
A type of scissor-style [[tongs]] with two scoops/molds on each side.  They're used to pick up material and form it into a shape, commonly a ball, when closed.  Various types of these tongs are used for various purposes such as making [[snowball]]s, [[meatball]]s, and cake balls.

Sold under various names such as: meat baller tongs, cake ball tongs, snowball maker tool

title: hank_anderson
body:
The human protaganist of [[Detroit: Become Human]]. Hank is a Detroit Police detective assigned to investigate the growing number of deviant androids and is ordered to work with [[connor_(detroit)|Connor]] over the course of his assignment. Hank is distrustful of androids following a previous incident and initially has a hard time getting along with Connor as a result. Whether this relationship improves or degrades depends on player actions while in control of Connor.

Hank is an older man with graying hair and a trimmed beard. He is usually seen in darker clothing and carries a [[revolver]] as a personal weapon.
other_names: ハンク・アンダーソン

title: markus_(detroit)
body:
One of the three protaganist androids in [[Detroit: Become Human]]. Markus was acquired by an older owner who purposefully instilled a sense of individuality in him, though it was ultimately a bloody break-in incident that resulted in him gaining sapience and becoming a deviant. Left for dead after being shot by responding Detroit Police officers, Markus would fall in with a group of deviant androids called "Jericho" and lead them into a revolution. Whether their uprising ends in peaceful or violent fashion depends on the player's actions with him and the other controllable characters.

Markus is a darker-skinned individual with short-cropped, dark hair and brown eyes, and is usually seen wearing a tan and gray overcoat above his normal android outfit.

title: kara_(detroit)
body:
One of the three main protagonist androids of [[Detroit: Become Human]]. Kara is an android meant for domestic housework purchased by an abusive owner. The stress from her treatment resulted in her becoming a deviant and running away along with her owner's daughter [spoiler]who is revealed to be an android as well[/spoiler]. The goal of the two is to escape into Canada, which has no laws concerning androids.

Kara has short, brown/blonde hair and blue eyes. Her base outfit is a black-and-white shirt and leggings, with the shirt indicating her model number (AX-400). Her outfit while attempting to blend into the human population includes a heavy vest to cover it up.

title: connor_(detroit)
body:
One of the principal protaganist characters of [[Detroit: Become Human]]. Connor is a model of [[android]] specialized in criminal investigations, assigned to a human partner named [[Hank Anderson]] following incidents in which androids went rogue and murdered their owners. In the course of his investigation, he can bond or break apart with Hank while having an influence on the outcome of a budding android revolution.

Connor is fair-skinned with dark hair and blue or silver eyes, in addition to having a legally-mandated LED above his right eye to indicate that he is an android. He usually wears a suit, with the jacket indicating his model (RK-800).

Note that the sailor collar should be attached to the swimsuit itself; don't use this tag if there is a [[serafuku]] shirt over the swimsuit. For instance in post #482820, the middle character has a proper sailor one-piece, while the other two don't. Use the [[serafuku]] and [[swimsuit under clothes]] tags instead.

For the [[Idolmaster]] costume, see [[sailor swimsuit (idolmaster)]].

title: sonic_the_hedgehog_(satam)
body:
[b]Sonic the Hedgehog[/b] is an American-Italian animated television series created by DiC Entertainment and the Italian studio Reteitalia, in association with Telecinco. The series contrasts with [[Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog]], which premiered on the same year, for featuring darker stories and elements. Also know by the fans as [b]Sonic SatAM[/b] to differentiate it from other series, because it was a Saturday morning cartoon. The series and characters would later be incorporated into [[Sonic the Hedgehog (Archie Comics)|Sonic's long-time running]] [[Archie Comics]] series.

title: priestess_(fabiniku)
body: Priestess (神官) is a minor female character from the series [i][[Fantasy Bishoujo Juniku Ojisan to]][/i].  She appears in chapters 37 to 39 of the manga and episode 8 of the anime.  She acts as the guide for the protagonists at the temple for the [[Goddess of Love and Beauty (fabiniku)|]].  Initially wearing a [[nun]] outfit, she later removes it revealing the temple's official garb of a skimpy [[swimsuit]].

In his original form he has [[brown hair]] and [[hair over eyes|long bangs covering his eyes]], while in his girl form he has [[long hair|long]] golden [[blonde hair]], [[blue eyes]], and [[sharp teeth]].

title: f5_(wrestling)
body:
Also known as a [i]Fireman's Carry Facebuster[/i], this [[wrestling]] move sees a [[wrestler]] lift an opponent up in a [[fireman's carry]] across their shoulders, then throw the opponent's legs out in front of them to spin them out, while simultaneously falling backwards or forwards, causing the opponent to land on their face and upper body. 

It is popularized by [[WWE]] wrestler [[Brock Lesnar]], who named it after the highest rating of the Fujita Scale (a scale for rating tornado intensity, which is measured from F0 to F5) due to the spinning part of the move.

title: sensha_otoko
body:
Type-Moon Official April Fool's Joke for April 2009, Sensha Otoko (Tank Man, a parody of the popular "true story" love comedy, [[Densha Otoko]] (Train Man)). The characters are mostly from Fate/Zero, with a few appearances from Fate/Stay Night characters. 

This is a story about 212cm military otaku with "Sensha Otoko" as his handle name, who despite his huge, imposing appearance, is actually very shy, and thus no girlfriends. One day, he saves a teenage girl from being harassed, and falls in love. However, because he has no experience in romance, he consults his [[otaku]] friends on the web-board Eirei Throne-Channel for advice. This is the beginning of a True Tank Story.

h4. Character 

h6. Main Characters

* [[iskandar (sensha otoko) (fate)|"Sensha Otoko"]] - Protagonist. ([[Iskandar (fate)|]])
* [[waver velvet (sensha otoko)|"El-Melloi Girl"]] - Heroine. ([[Waver Velvet]])

h6. Sensha Otoko's Friends From Eirei Throne Channel

* [[medea (sensha otoko) (fate)|"Medea"]] - a former model betrayed by her boyfriend. ([[Medea (fate)|]])
* [[gilgamesh (sensha otoko) (fate)|"Gil"]] - a cool hikikomori stalker. ([[Gilgamesh (fate)|]])
* [[berserker (sensha otoko) (fate)|"U to O"]] - a helmet-wearing man who fears facial exposure and eye-contact. ([[Berserker (Fate/Zero)]])
* "Danna" - Criminal No. 1. ([[Gilles de rais (caster) (fate)|]])
* "Ryuu-chan" - Criminal No. 2. ([[Uryuu Ryuunosuke]])
* "Godbull" - an intelligent fighter bull who knows how to access the internet.

h6. El-Melloi Family

* Papa - a man who loves his wife above all else, and despises his son. ([[Kayneth El-Melloi Archibald]])
* Mama - a woman who loves her eldest son above all else. ([[Sola-Ui Nuada-Re Sophia-Ri]])
* [[diarmuid ua duibhne (sensha otoko) (fate)|Onii-chan]] - an older brother who loves his younger sister above all else. ([[Diarmuid ua duibhne (lancer) (fate)|]])

h6. Supporting Cast

* [[sasaki kojirou (sensha otoko) (fate)|Sasaki]] - "Medea's" friendzoned male caretaker. ([[Sasaki kojirou (fate)|]])
* [[enkidu (sensha otoko) (fate)|"Enkidu-chan"]] - "Gil's" childhood friend and next door neighbor, a girl who loves her dog. ([[Enkidu (fate)|]])
* Matsuken - a mysterious, wise English teacher. 
* [[Kotomine Kirei (sensha otoko)|]] - The Tohsaka family's housekeeper, and "Gil's" caretaker.

h4. External links

* "Official Site":http://tatari.byethost33.com/tmfools/09/sensya/intro.htm
* "Type-Moon 2009 April Fools Site":http://tatari.byethost33.com/tmfools/09/index.htm
* "Ufotable 2012 April Fools [i]Sensha Otoko[/i] Movie Site":http://www.ufotable.com/tankman/index.html

title: kotomine_kirei_(sensha_otoko)
body: [[Kotomine Kirei]] as depicted in the [[Sensha Otoko]] April Fools joke of 2009. In this universe, he works as a housekeeper for the Tohsaka family, and is [[gilgamesh (sensha otoko) (fate)|Gil]]'s caretaker. He's distinguishable by the [[pink apron]] he wears over his black clothes.

title: diarmuid_ua_duibhne_(sensha_otoko)_(fate)
body: [[diarmuid ua duibhne (lancer) (fate)|Diarmuid Ua Duibhne]] as depicted in the [[Sensha Otoko]] April Fools joke of 2009. In this universe, he is the elder son of the El-Melloi family, and [[waver velvet (sensha otoko)|"El-Melloi Girl"]] is his younger sister whom he adores.

title: waver_velvet_(sensha_otoko)
body:
[[Waver Velvet]] as depicted in the [[Sensha Otoko]] April Fools joke for 2009. Here, he has [[genderswap (mtf)|become a girl]] named "El-Melloi Girl", and is the main heroine. She lives with her family - Papa El-Melloi, Mama El-Melloi, and [[diarmuid ua duibhne (sensha otoko) (fate)|Big Brother]]. [[iskandar (sensha otoko) (fate)|"Sensha Otoko"]] falls in love with her, but is too shy to approach her.

Since El-Melloi Girl is a female version of Waver, she wears a skirt and thighhighs in place of pants.

title: sasaki_kojirou_(fate)
body:
[[Fate (series)|Fate series]] character. An Assassin-class Servant who appears in [[Fate/stay night]] and [[Fate/Grand Order]].

He has [[blue eyes]] and [[blue hair]] tied into a [[ponytail]]. He is often seen wearing [[Japanese clothes]] and wielding a [[sword]].

In [[Fate/stay night]], he is a Servant summoned by [[Medea (fate)|]], another Servant, which is normally against the rules of the Holy Grail War. This makes him weaker than a normal Servant and dependent on Caster for mana. In the [[Heaven's Feel]] route, he is killed and his body is used to summon [[Hassan of the Cursed Arm (Fate)|]], the True Assassin.

[b]True Name:[/b] [[Sasaki Kojirou]]

title: iskandar_(sensha_otoko)_(fate)
body:
[[Iskandar (fate)|]] as depicted in the [[Sensha Otoko]] April Fools joke for 2009. In this universe, he is only known by his web-board username "Sensha Otoko" ("Tank Man"). He is incredibly shy and cannot get a girlfriend, but falls in love with a girl known as [[waver velvet (sensha otoko)|"El-Melloi Girl"]]. Sensha Otoko asks for romantic advice from his online buddies on Eirei Throne-Channel.

Sensha Otoko looks slightly different from Iskandar in that his hair is messier, and he wears [[glasses]].

title: tadano_kazuhito
body: Baseball player for the the Cleveland Indians and [[Manatsu No Yo No Inmu]] actor in college. Following his identity leak as a gay porn actor, no team in Japan would hire him, causing him to leave for America. During the scandal, his name was abbreviated to TDN, which became the common abbreviating standard for Inmu and later [[Cookie (touhou)|]].

title: ame-no-uzume-no-mikoto
body:
Ame-no-Uzume-no-mikoto (天宇受売命, 天鈿女命?) is the goddess of dawn, mirth and revelry in the Shinto religion of Japan, and the wife of fellow-god Sarutahiko Ōkami. She famously relates to the tale of the missing sun deity, Amaterasu Omikami. Her name can also be pronounced as Ama-no-Uzume.[1][2]

Amaterasu's brother, the storm god Susano'o, had vandalized her rice fields, threw a flayed horse at her loom, and brutally killed one of her maidens due to a quarrel between them. In turn, Amaterasu became furious with him and retreated into the Heavenly Rock Cave, Amano-Iwato. The world, without the illumination of the sun, became dark and the gods could not lure Amaterasu out of her hiding place.

The clever Uzume overturned a tub near the cave entrance and began a dance on it, tearing off her clothing in front of the other deities. They considered this so comical that they laughed heartily at the sight.[3] This dance is said to have founded the Japanese ritual dance, Kagura. [4]

Amaterasu heard them, and peered out to see what all the fuss was about. When she opened the cave, she saw her glorious reflection in a mirror which Uzume had placed on a tree, and slowly emerged from her hiding spot.

At that moment, the god Ame-no-Tajikarawo-no-mikoto dashed forth and closed the cave behind her, refusing to budge so that she could no longer retreat. Another god tied a magic shimenawa across the entrance.[5] The deities Ame-no-Koyane-no-mikoto and Ame-no-Futodama-no-mikoto then asked Amaterasu to rejoin the divine. She agreed, and light was restored to the earth.

Ame-no-Uzume-no-Mikoto is still worshiped today as a Shinto kami, spirits indigenous to Japan.[6] She is also known as Ame-no-Uzume-no-Mikoto, The Great Persuader, and The Heavenly Alarming Female.[7] She is depicted in kyōgen farce as Okame, a woman who revels in her sensuality

---
Complete "Wikipedia":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ame-no-Uzume-no-Mikoto for links to more information

title: temujin_(housamo)
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[gamma dh]]

With the pride of a ruler and the persistence of an avenger, he will never let any traitor go unpunished, following them to the ends of the Earth to deal brutal revenge. His tenacity stems from having been betrayed by one close to him who he trusted deeply. Now, he has given up on open trust as a general rule. His Sacred Artifact is a divine bow which symbolizes the power of his ancestors. Its arrows home relentlessly on the enemy, wherever they may go, and will surely pierce them, thanks to the combined powers of pursuit and accuracy ingrained in its Rule.

h4. External links

* "Housamo Wiki: Temujin":https://housamo.wiki/Temujin

title: macan_(housamo)
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[gamma dh]]

The champion of the underground pro wrestling scene in Ikebukuro. He was summoned from the world called Shangri-La to immediately be sold in an illegal Transient auction. He was traded like merchandise but then killed his abusive Summoner and escaped, becoming a Stray Transient. Because he respects individuals who rely on their physical strength, he detests those who use underlings to fight their battles. 

h4. External links

* "Housamo Wiki: Macan":https://housamo.wiki/Macan

title: yule_(housamo)
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[gamma dh]]

A fey reindeer Transient from the world of Tir na Nog who dreams of becoming a Santa Claus. In Tokyo, various Santas from various worlds have gathered at the academy he attends. They are currently receiving lessons on how to achieve that status. He's typically cheerful but has a nervous personality. Whenever he causes trouble and is laughed at by others, he falls into depression as soon as he is alone.

h4. External links

* "Housamo Wiki: Yule":https://housamo.wiki/Yule

title: makara_(housamo)
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[gamma dh]]

A Transient who works part time as a lifeguard at the beach in Edogawa Ward. He's a soft-hearted athlete belonging to his high school water polo team. His eyes are droopy, making him look sleepy all the time, but they sharpen right up once he enters the water. He will never overlook any aquatic accidents and detests anyone who doesn't value their own life.

h4. External links

* "Housamo Wiki: Makara":https://housamo.wiki/Makara

title: ophion_(housamo)
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[gamma dh]]

The arrogant and brazen Transient who is the self-proclaimed creator of the world called Olympus. He is an ancient dragon and believes that his age is his greatest asset. While many rulers from different worlds gather in the Roppongi Guild, the Tycoons, he exhibits an exceptional amount of influence. When fighting enemies he deems to be inferior to him, his pride forbids him from sullying his hands in battle. Thus, he sweeps the enemy with his flame breath as his primary weapon.

h4. External links

* "Housamo Wiki: Ophion":https://housamo.wiki/Ophion

title: ahab_(housamo)
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[gamma dh]]

Captain of a whaling ship with a prosthetic leg. He is a Water Buffalo Therian. When protagonist's ship was wrecked in the colliding of world in Tokyo Bay as it merged with the 23 seas, he picked them up. Right after that, he gave them a long, hard lesson on the treacherous seas. He has been chasing his sea monster across the oceans in pursuit of revenge. Sometimes, he lets that rage get the better of him, causing him to lose sight of himself. He takes pride in his position as captain and demands that his crew accept his orders without question. In return, he will accept even those with guilty consciences among his crew no matter what they have done.


h4. External links

* "Housamo Wiki: Ahab":https://housamo.wiki/Ahab

title: garmr_(housamo)
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[gamma dh]]

This Transient is not good at thinking too deeply. He is a loyal dog who loves being depended on and thus ordered to do something important. He presently acts as gatekeeper to the Ikebukuro Guild. Because he doesn't think much, he causes a lot of trouble and some abrasive types have taken to labeling him a useless mutt. However, when it comes to holding down the fort, he is a guardian of the highest caliber. He openly displays his hostility toward rival guard dogs of a similar nature.

h4. External Links

* "Housamo Wiki: Garmr":[https://housamo.wiki/Garmr]

title: kinu_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
[[kinu (kancolle)|Kinu's]] second remodel.

With her second remodel she obtains a new uniform identical to Abukuma's. The serafuku now consists of a short-sleeved black jacket over a beige top, a grey sailor collar and grey pleated skirt with bike shorts underneath. She also now wears a red neck ribbon and black partially fingerless gloves, while retaining her boots. Gameplay-wise she notably gains a unique innate boost to resource gain from expeditions equal to a single Daihatsu, two of which appear on her rigging. The downside is that she does not share the ability to equip midget submarines for opening torpedo attacks that Abukuma and Yura have.

title: hatsushimo_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
[[hatsushimo_(kancolle)|Hatsushimo's]] second remodel.

For her second remodel (post #1908456), her blazer and skirt gain a small white inline along the brim and borders, her necktie is removed, a blue [[headband]] around her head, a [[single_thighhigh]] (emulating [[yamato_(kancolle)|Yamato]]?), rolled sleeves, new AA guns, a torpedo refill on her thigh (think of [[akizuki_(kancolle)|Akizuki]]) and the disposition of her guns are reversed (single gun held with her right hand instead of her left hand). Before the introduction of [[warspite_(kancolle)|Warspite]] and [[jervis_(kancolle)|Jervis]], she also had the particularity of having the second highest base luck and the highest max luck in the game.

h4. Hatsuharu-class destroyers with kai ni:
* [[hatsuharu kai ni (kancolle)|Hatsuharu]] (初春)
* [b]Hatsushimo[/b] (初霜)

title: hatsuharu_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
[[hatsuharu_(kancolle)|Hatsuharu's]] second remodel.

In her second remodel, her clothes and rigging design are revamped. Her sailor dress is now sleeveless, button-up and features a pattern along the brim and collar. Her tie is replaced with a metal piece holding more shide. Her {{thighhighs}} and elbow gloves are shortened and are visually replaced with a pair of heels and wide white gloves. Her rigging is more detailed and replaces the gun drones on flexible arms with a fixed twin gun and a stack of two triple torpedo launchers on more robust arms. The "floating chevron thing" over her head has been redesigned to be simpler as well. Her hair is slightly longer at the front and gained volume on the back. She also holds a new folding fan as well.

h4. Hatsuharu-class destroyers with kai ni:
* [b]Hatsuharu[/b] (初春)
* [[hatsushimo kai ni (kancolle)|Hatsushimo (Kancolle)]] (初霜)

title: apex_legends:_pathfinder's_quest
body:
An [[Apex Legends]] novel/lore book released on February 2, 2021. The novel focuses on [[Pathfinder (apex legends)|]] as he interviews the other legends (up to [[Horizon (apex legends)|]]) about their pasts and how they may lead him to find his creator.

The final chapter from the book was partially adapted into an "animated short":[https://twitter.com/playapex/status/1407383128331726850] posted to the official Apex Twitter account. The short debuts an alternate design for Pathfinder in the past, where he has a set of emotive mechanical ears.

The book's Japanese release features cover art by [[Mika Pikazo]].

title: kira_yoshikage
body:
The main antagonist of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 4, [[Diamond wa Kudakenai]].

A serial killer who uses his [[Stand (Jojo)|]], [[Killer Queen]], to kill beautiful women for their hands, which he finds extremely attractive. He typically dresses in a [[suit]] with a distinctive skull-print [[necktie]] (example: post #404241).

[spoiler]After his identity is revealed to the main cast, he manages to switch all his identifying features with those of [[Kawajiri Kosaku]] and steals his identity.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]He's the protagonist of the spinoff [[Dead Man's Questions]].[/spoiler]

title: megamari
body:
MegaMari is a [[Mega Man (series)|]] clone Doujin soft created by Twilight Frontier starring [[Kirisame Marisa]] and [[Alice Margatroid]].

Having grown tired of Marisa constantly bringing home big hauls of books from the Voile Library, [[Patchouli Knowledge]] attempts to stop the incessant theft by stashing her books in her newly-created castle and hires several other characters to protect her palace. But Marisa, aided by Alice, sets out to defeat her friends before making a climactic raid on Patchouli's trap-laden castle to bring home another big haul of books.

This game is considered "one of the hardest games ever", since it is a clone of the Mega Man games with the Danmaku shooting tradition of the [[Touhou]] series.

body:
One of the five Greeed monsters of [[Kamen Rider OOO (series)|Kamen Rider OOO]].

Unlike the rest of the Greeed, Ankh has lost his body except for his right arm. He is depicted as either a disembodied floating arm or possessing the body of [[Izumi Shingo]]. When the latter happens, he appears as a wise man who appears to be arrogant towards [[Hino Eiji]], with weird blonde hair.

title: bohegao
body:
A variant of the [[ahegao]] [[Saikawa Riko]] from  [[Kobayashi-san Chi no Maidragon]] makes when getting attention (which she interprets romantically, even if it's sometimes not really meant that way) from [[yuri|her love interest]] [[Kanna Kamui]].

The facial expression is a typical [[ahegao]] ([[full-face blush]], [[rolling_eyes|rolled-up eyes]], raised eyebrows, goofy smile) with [[hands_on_own_face|hands on her cheeks]], a [[heart in mouth|heart symbol in the mouth]] and the eponymous "boheeeeee" (a [[sound effects|sound effect]] for a scream of exhilaration).

title: ghidorah_(godzilla:_the_planet_eater)
body:
[b]To that which brought the end of our civilization, we hesitate greatly to carelessly say its name. Words just have that much strength.[/b]
— Metphies in City on the Edge of Battle's epilogue.

[b]Ghidorah[/b] was first alluded to in the 2018 film, [[Godzilla: City on the Edge of Battle]], where Metphies says the name of an unspeakable destructive force to Haruo Sakaki, that being Ghidorah.

He will presumably play a role in the sequel to City on the Edge of Battle, [[Godzilla: The Planet Eater]], and has been referenced in posters and teasers for the film.

title: kawashima_mizuki
body:
An [i][[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Cool (Blue Diamond) category. 

Mizuki is a former newscaster, and a calm and mature woman. As one of the oldest idols, she is somewhat self-conscious of her age. She is also the oldest to get a CD debut so far. In the anime, she hosts a game show with [[Totoki Airi]].

As said before, due to her popularity, she was selected for the third CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Totoki Airi]], [[Tada Riina]], [[Honda Mio]] and [[Kohinata Miho]]. Her seiyuu is [[Touyama Nao]].

title: ore_no_kanojo_to_osananajimi_ga_shuraba_sugiru
body:
Lit. [i]My Girlfriend and Childhood Friend Fight Too Much[/i], abbreviated as [i]OreShura[/i] (俺修羅)

A 2011-current light novel series by Yuuji Yuuji, with illustrations by [[Ruroo]], published by SoftBank Creative under their GA Bunko imprint. Also adapted into a 2011-2014 manga by [[Nanasuke]], serialized in Square Enix's [i]Gangan Joker[/i], a 4koma manga by [[Marimo (t2 h t)|]] in [i]Young Gangan[/i], [i]Ore no Kanojo to Osananajimi ga Shuraba Sugiru+H[/i] by [[Inase Shin'ya]] in [i]Big Gangan[/i] from 2011-12, [i]Ore no Kanojo to Osananajimi ga Shuraba Sugiru Ai[/i] by [[Mutsutake]], also in [i]Big Gangan[/i], and a Winter 2013 anime by A-1 Pictures.

h4. Characters

* [[Akishino Himeka]]
* [[Asoi Kaoru]]
* [[Fuyuumi Ai]]
* [[Kidou Eita]]
* [[Harusaki Chiwa]]

title: europa_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
A [[Granblue Fantasy]] character.

Voiced by [[Nakahara Mai]].

The maiden blessed by water descends to the sky realm. While setting out to fulfill a mission assigned to her by a dear primarch ([[gabriel_(granblue_fantasy)|Gabriel]]) and to satisfy her own inner desires, Europa has an epiphany—that those who dwell in the mortal world possess a most charming luminosity about them. This remarkable discovery piques her curiosity regarding all things mortal and reinforces her desire to gaze upon further beauty.

* "Granblue Fantasy Wiki: Europa":https://gbf.wiki/Europa
other_names: エウロペ(神撃のバハムート)

title: rackam_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
A [[Granblue Fantasy]] character.

Voiced by [[Hirata Hiroaki]].

The smoking go-getter of a helmsman at Port Breeze. His shooting abilities are as impressive as his ability to control an airship. He's very blunt, but incredibly helpful and well liked. When the captain's ([[Gran_(granblue_fantasy)|Gran]]) small group landed on the port, he becomes entangled in the conflict that surrounds the party against the Erste Empire.

h4. External links

* "Granblue Fantasy Wiki: Rackam":https://gbf.wiki/Rackam

title: michael_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
A [[Granblue Fantasy]] character.

Voiced by [[Mitsuishi Kotono]].

Gaze upon the fire's light, burning since the dawn of antiquity. It illuminates the way for the unsteady amble of the babe, reaching those of weak-willed hearts, and revealing pasts shrouded in mystery. The archangel's flames burns alongside civilization, her protection yet to be extinguished. She empathizes with skydwellers, bearing an attitude of cooperation.

h4. External links

* "Granblue Fantasy Wiki: Michael":https://gbf.wiki/Michael

title: shiva_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
A [[Granblue Fantasy]] character originally from Rage of Bahamut.

Voiced by [[Hayami Shou]].

Disciple of the Primarch [[michael_(granblue_fantasy)|Michael]] and Primal of both war and salvation, he appears before the Captain ([[Gran_(granblue_fantasy)|Gran]]) on Kluger Island to test their strength. He officially joins the crew when they encounter each other again on a dreary, plague-infested island.

h4. External links

* "Granblue Fantasy Wiki: Shiva":https://gbf.wiki/Shiva

title: gabriel_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
A [[Granblue Fantasy]] character.

Voiced by [[Kouda Mariko]].

Water operates according to a fickle cycle: sometimes acting as a blessing, other times a disaster. The primarch of water, possessed of this same nature, watches quietly over the flow of life, ensuring that balance is forever maintained. Every now and then she will assume the form of a mortal and live among them to satisfy her interest in people-watching.

h4. External links

* "Granblue Fantasy Wiki: Gabriel":https://gbf.wiki/Gabriel

title: soriz
body:
[i][[Granblue Fantasy]][/i] character.

Voiced by [[Koyama Rikiya]].

Old warrior, champion of countless fighting tournaments, and unapologetic pervert, Soriz joins the crew to hone his skills even further. And also because it has cute girls in it. 

h4. External links

* "Granblue Fantasy Wiki: Soriz":https://gbf.wiki/Soriz

title: beelzebub_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
A [[Granblue Fantasy]] character.

The hooded figure, a former astral, and a schemer seeking to make use of [[lucilius_(granblue_fantasy)|Lucilius]] dark and light legacy with his fellow conspirator [[belial_(granblue_fantasy)|Belial]]. His ultimate desire is to govern the skies as the supreme king. Eluding death time after time and harboring the powers of both beast and chaos, this personification of a monstrous chimera continues to reign as a dark threat to the skies.

h4. External links

* "Granblue Fantasy Wiki: Beelzebub":https://gbf.wiki/Beelzebub

title: metal_max
body:
[b]Metal Max[/b] is a non-linear, post-apocalyptic role-playing game series, created by Hiroshi Miyaoka of CreaTech, that had a primary focus on vehicular combat including [[tank|tanks]]. Data East filing for bankruptcy in 2003 caused trademark issues, resulting in a spin-off series called "[[Metal Saga]]" to be made under Success, but these issues were later resolved in 2009 under Enterbrain which marked the revival of the "Metal Max" series.

h4. Games
h5. Metal Max series
* Metal Max (Metal Max Returns)
* [[Metal Max 2]] (Metal Max 2 Kai, [[Metal Max 2 Reloaded]])
* [[Metal Max 3]]
* Metal Max 4: Moonlight Diva
* [[Metal Max Xeno]]

h5. Metal Saga series
* [[Metal Saga]] (Metal Saga: Chain of Sandstorm)
* Metal Saga: Season of Steel
* [[Metal Saga: New Frontier]]
* Metal Saga: The Ark of Wastes

title: metal_max_2
body:
Metal Max 2 is the second entry in the [[Metal Max]] series. It was a vehicle combat RPG published in Japan by Data East in 1993 for the [[Super Famicom]] in 1993.

Ten years later in 2003, the game was ported to the [[Game Boy Advance]] with a few new bounties by Now Production under the title Metal Max 2 Kai.

In December 8, 2011, a full remake with upgraded graphics in the vein of [[Metal Max 3]] and using its game engine was released in Japan for the [[Nintendo DS]] and titled [[Metal Max 2 Reloaded]].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Metal Max 2":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metal_Max_2]

title: coco_(disney)
body:
Coco is a 2017 American computer-animated fantasy film produced by [[Pixar]] Animation Studios and released by Walt [[Disney]] Pictures. 

The story follows a 12-year-old boy named Miguel who is accidentally transported to the Land of the Dead, where he seeks the help of his deceased musician great-great-grandfather to return him to his family among the living and to reverse his family's ban on music.

The concept for Coco is inspired by the [[mexico|Mexican]] holiday Day of the Dead ([[Dia de Muertos]]).

h4. Characters
* [[Miguel Rivera]]
* [[Hector Rivera]]
* [[Ernesto de la Cruz]]
* [[Mama Coco]]
* [[Imelda Rivera]]

title: bulldozer
body:
A [b]bulldozer[/b] is a large and heavy tracked [[tractor]] equipped with a substantial metal blade used to push large quantities of soil, sand, rubble, or other materials during construction work and typically equipped at the rear with a claw-like ripper device to loosen densely compacted materials. Commonly found on [[construction site]]s.

h4. See also
* [[Front-end Loader]]

title: kuji_chikai
body:
[i][[Sarazanmai]][/i] character. 

The older brother of [[Kuji Toi]]. A ruthless gangster that makes enemies wherever he goes. He used to be in charge of taking care of Tooi after their parents' death, but puts him under the care of their aunt and uncle afterwards. [spoiler]In truth, he cares for Tooi deep down, and started his life of crime by taking the credit for Tooi shooting his gang boss.[/spoiler]

title: st._javelin
body: A personification of the [[FGM-148 Javelin]] that began to appear on social media following the [[russo-ukrainian war|2022 Russian Invasion of Ukraine]]. Ukraine had received hundreds of the anti-tank missiles in the lead-up to the invasion, which would prove to be highly effective against Russian armor. Because of this, social media observers began expressing joking religious reverence for the weapon. Saint Javelin is usually portrayed as a variant on the [[Virgin Mary]], with her holding the launcher instead of the infant Christ.

title: itsukushima_shrine
body:
The [b]Itsukushima Shrine[/b] (厳島神社 [i]Itsukushima-jinja[/i]) is a Shinto shrine in the small island of "Itsukushima":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Itsukushima located in Japan's Inland Sea. It is famous for its [[torii]] which is partially submerged in water during high tide and able to be approached during low tide, making it a beautiful sight and a popular tourist attraction.

h4. See also
* "Wikipedia Article on the Itsukushima Shrine":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Itsukushima_Shrine

title: water_wheel
body:
A machine used to convert the energy of running [[water]] into useful mechanical power. It consists of a [[wheel]] with fixed blades that intercept the flow of water. Water wheels were used in the pre-modern era for grinding grain in gristmills or powering industrial machinery, but they have since been replaced with other forms of power.

The modern equivalent of the water wheel is the water turbine, used to generate power in hydroelectric [[dam|dams]].

h4.See also

* [[factory]]
* [[stream]]
* [[waterfall]]
* [[windmill]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Water wheel":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Water_wheel

title: ferris_(rust)
body:
Ferris the crab. Ferris is the unofficial mascot of the Rust Programming Language.

Many Rust programmers call themselves "Rustaceans", a play on the word "crustacean". Crustacean are a family of animals that include crabs, lobsters, crayfish, shrimp, krill and barnacles.

Ferris is a name playing off of the adjective "ferrous", meaning of or pertaining to iron. Since Rust often forms on iron it seemed like a fun origin for the mascot’s name.

h4. See also

* [b]Rust:[/b] [[rust (programming language)]]
* [b]Other mascot:[/b] [[corro (rust)]]
* [b]Ferris on rust homepage:[/b] https://www.rust-lang.org/learn/get-started#ferris
* [b]Webpage with images:[/b] https://rustacean.net/

title: manannan_mac_lir_(fate)
body:
Alter Ego-class Servant introduced in the Valentine 2022 event of [[Fate/Grand Order]]. A Pseudo-Servant using [[Bazett Fraga McRemitz]] as his vessel. The Celtic god of the sea and the Otherworld, who owns many magical items such as a self-navigating boat named Sguaba Tuinne, the horse Aonbharr that can cross water, and the mystical sword [[Fragarach (fate)|]].

His name is stylized as [b]Manannán mac Lir[/b].

body:
Originally a normal human being, Marcheline became an immortal since the moment she was chosen to be the Gatekeeper of Three Worlds. title: aim-54_phoenix
body:
The AIM-54 Phoenix is an American radar-guided, hypersonic, long-range air-to-air [[missile]] (AAM), carried in clusters of up to six missiles on the Grumman [[F-14 Tomcat]], its only operational launch platform.

The Phoenix was the United States' only long-range air-to-air [[missile]]. The combination of Phoenix [[missile]] and the AN/AWG-9 guidance radar was the first aerial weapons system that could simultaneously engage multiple targets. Due to its active radar tracking, the brevity code "Fox Three" was used when firing the AIM-54.

Both the [[missile]] and the [[aircraft]] were used by Iran and the [[United States Navy]]. In US service both are now retired, the AIM-54 Phoenix in 2004 and the F-14 in 2006. They were replaced by the shorter-range [[AIM-120 AMRAAM]], employed on the [[f-18_hornet|F/A-18 Hornet]] and F/A-18E/F Super Hornet—in its AIM-120D version, the latest version of the AMRAAM just matches the Phoenix's maximum range.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: AIM-54 Phoenix":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AIM-54_Phoenix]

title: quiltra-quelamitz
body:
A massive [[alien]] [[spacecraft]] from the [[Macross]] series.

The [b]Quiltra-Quelamitz Class Medium-Scale Gunboat[/b] is a powerful [[Zentradi]] warship. 

Though the craft is somewhat small by the standards of most Zentradi ships of the line, it possesses one of the most devastating weapons of the fleet. The forward half of the craft is dominated by the main gun, a heavy converging energy beam cannon. 

The bow splits in half vertically, collimating the energy of the blast just prior to release. The main gun can blast through the most heavily armored hypercarbon hulls of enemy spacecraft and can rain high-energy mass destruction down upon a planetary body. 

With it's powerful primary weapon, the Quiltra-Quelamitz is the backbone of any large-scale fleet-to-fleet engagement and a necessary tool for operations requiring effective planetary bombardment. 

Though primarily an anti-ship/anti-fortifications vessel, the Quiltra-Quelamitz does feature many conventional energy cannon and [[missile]] emplacements upon its hull and carries a modest complement of [[Nousjadeul-Ger]] [[power armor]]s for anti-[[mecha]] attack and defense.

This ship was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the early 80s.

title: tie_fighter
body:
A fictional attack [[spacecraft]] from the [[Star Wars]] universe.

The [i]Sienar Fleet Systems[/i] TIE/ln [[starfighter]] or TIE/line, simply known as the [b]TIE Fighter[/b], was the standard Imperial starfighter seen in massive numbers throughout most of the Galactic Civil War and onward. It was designed in-universe by the Empire's weapon designer [[death_star|Raith Sienar]], famous for creating many other Imperial weaponry.

This one-man small attack craft was highly maneuverable and fast, but lacked deflector shields, so it was usually deployed in vast numbers. It was armed with two laser cannons. The craft also didn't have any hyperdrive, making it dependant on larger vessels for hyperspace travel.

The name TIE Fighter stands for [b]T[/b]win [b]I[/b]on [b]E[/b]ngine Fighter.

In [[real life]] it was designed by "Ralph McQuarrie":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ralph_McQuarrie in the 70s.

h4. See also

* [[TIE Interceptor]]
* [[TIE Advanced X1]]

title: city_7
body:
A fictional massive [[spacecraft]] from the [[Macross]] [[Science fiction]] series. It first appeared in the [[Macross 7]] TV series from the 90s. 

The [b]City Class Spaceships[/b] are designed as the super-long-distance colonization vessels of the New Macross Class. These ships almost always remain docked to the Battle Class vessels except in time of battle when the carrier will detach from the power plant docking unit mounted at the fore of the City ship. 

Inside the City Class ships is a fully functional 6 km long city of roughly 350,000 people beneath the main dome. Outside the main city dome there is docking bay island (approximately 300 meters long) and the event dome. The City ships are powered by a separate overtechnology reactor and even feature a basic space fold system for short-range interstellar travel. 

The City Class ships have no weapons and the City ship docked with the first Battle Class, Macross 1, had no defensive system. However, later City Class ships are all designed with a defensive shell that covers the city section of the craft in times of emergency (though both the docking bay island and the event domes remain uncovered by the shell).

Perhaps the most distinguished ship of this class is the [[Macross 7]] of the 37th long-distance colonization fleet that took part in the [[Protodeviln]]/[[U.N. Spacy]] War of 2045. The City class ships were eventually succeded by the [[island_1|Island]] class starships.

This ship was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the 90s.

h4. See also

* [[Battle 7]]

title: devcon
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Devcon[/b] is an heroic [[Autobot]], a sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] bounty hunter that can transform into a blue long-range attack [[spacecraft]].

In Japan his name was changed to [b]Defcon[/b] (デフコン Defukon), a reference to the term DEFCON, an acronym related to a state of [[military]] alertness in the United States of America. Although unconfirmed, it is thought that, along with the embargo on the word "nuclear", the writers of the Generation 1 cartoon were not allowed to use the actual word in light of heightened Cold War tensions at the time, thus requiring a made-up soundalike word in the original American dub of the series.

Motto: [i]"I cannot allow any [[Decepticon]]s to escape, they must be stopped at all costs...!!!".[/i]

title: mercury_(spacecraft)
body:
Project Mercury was the first human spaceflight program of the United States. It ran from 1959 through 1963 with the goal of putting a human in orbit around the [[Earth (planet)|]] and do it before the [[Soviet]] Union as part of the early space race. 

Because of their small size, it was said that the [b]Mercury spacecraft[/b] were worn, not ridden. With 1.7 m³ of habitable volume, the [[spacecraft]] was just large enough for the single crew member. Inside were 120 controls: 55 electrical switches, 30 fuses and 35 mechanical levers. The spacecraft was designed by Max Faget and NASA's Space Task Group.

Despite the [[astronaut]]s' test pilot experience NASA at first envisioned them as "minor participants" during their flights, causing many conflicts between the astronauts and engineers during the spacecraft's design. Nonetheless, contrary to other reports, the project's leaders always intended for pilots to be able to control their spacecraft, as they valued humans' ability to contribute to missions' success. John Glenn's manual attitude adjustments during the first orbital flight were an example of the value of such control. The astronauts requested —and received— a larger window and manual reentry controls.

h4.See also

* [[Vostok]]

title: basestar
body:
A fictional [[robot]] [[space]] station from the [[Battlestar Galactica]] science fiction TV series.

The [b]Cylon Basestar[/b] is a massive, heavily armed and armored space station from where the Raiders and other [[Cylon]] spacecraft depart during their attacks against their human enemies.

They are usually deployed in groups of three, and also serve as command posts and resupply stations for the Cylon armies.

Hundreds of [[Raider (spacecraft)|Cylon Raiders]] can be stored in the Cylon Basestar's many hangar bays.

The Basestars are armed with many laser cannons and missile launchers, and can also launch nuclear strikes against enemy human capital [[spacecraft]] or even [[planet]]s.

title: battle_7
body:
A fictional massive [[spacecraft]] from the [[Macross]] [[Science fiction]] series. 

The [b]Battle Class Stealth Space Attack Carrier[/b] vessels are designed primarily as flagships for super-long-distance colonization fleets. 

Though armed for heavy anti-ship combat the primary role of the Battle Class is acting as a mobile command center and the largest [[space]] carrier in the fleet. 

The powerful main gun is a super beam weapon built as a mobile gunship separable from the ventral hull of the ship. The gunship is built with its own reactor and is capable of independent navigation if required. 

Like the [[SDF-1]] Macross Class Super Dimension Fortress ships that preceded them, the Battle Class vessels are fully transformable ships that can convert into a humanoid-shaped [[Storm Attacker]] mode. The main gun is supplemented with four beam cannons but no additional turret weapons or missile launchers are found in most ships of this class. The Battle Class instead carries a large number of over 700 variable fighters, attack craft and bombers that can engage enemy fleets and any enemy attack craft. 

For rapid deployment of all aerospace craft, the Battle Class has twelve total standard catapults; six on the forward deck, three on the center deck and three on the aft port side angled deck. The ship is also equipped with three additional electromagnetic catapults and a command liaison hatch mounted just forward of the main bridge for immediately launching interceptor-fighters (typically [[VF-17]]D [i]Nightmare[/i] variable fighters). 

For defense, the Battle Class has a [[pin-point barrier system]] and a short range full barrier system to defeat incoming enemy fire. In accordance with [[U.N. Spacy]] military doctrine for all ships of the line, the Battle Class also has a stealth composition superstrucure.

This ship was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the 90s.

title: island_1
body:
A fictional massive [[spacecraft]] from the [[Macross]] [[Science fiction]] series. It first appeared in the [[Macross Frontier]] TV series from 2008.

The enormous Macross Frontier Colony Fleet consists of the [[N.U.N.S.]] [[battle_frontier|Battle 25]] attached to the front of the massive [b]Island 1[/b] city ship, which is some 15 kilometers long (much larger than [[City 7]] from [[Macross 7]], which was some 6 kilometers in length). 

Nearly half of the 10 million residents of the Macross Frontier fleet reside in Island 1 under a dome some 2,000 meters in altitude. The ground levels feature metro areas, hills, rivers, and oceans. Sky city is located on the ceiling of the dome while there are several levels underground with residential zones and storage space, gravity generators, propulsion systems, and so on. The shell remains up normally but is closed during battles and space folds. 

A large cluster of other, smaller domed Islands are also attached directly to the Macross Frontier in two large chains trailing behind the Island 1. 

Island 3 is noted to contain an agricultural area, the [[Zentradi]] mall [i]Folmo[/i] and an [[alien]] lifeform research laboratory. 

In times of crisis, the individual Islands have defensive shutters that envelope the dome to protect those inside.

These ships were designed by [[Ishigaki Jun'ya]] from original designs by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]].

title: yuri_gagarin
body:
[b]Yuri Alekseyevich Gagarin[/b] (Russian: Ю́рий Алексе́евич Гага́рин,[1] Russian pronunciation: [ˈjurʲɪj ɐlʲɪˈksʲejɪvʲɪtɕ ɡɐˈɡarʲɪn]; 9 March 1934 – 27 March 1968) was a [[Soviet]] pilot and cosmonaut. He was the first human to journey into outer [[space]], when his Vostok [[spacecraft]] completed an orbit of the Earth on 12 April 1961.

Gagarin became an international celebrity, and was awarded many medals and honours, including "Hero of the Soviet Union", the nation's highest honour. Vostok 1 marked his only spaceflight, but he served as backup crew to the Soyuz 1 mission (which ended in a fatal crash). Gagarin later became deputy training director of the Cosmonaut Training Centre outside Moscow, which was later named after him. 

Yuri died in 1968, when his [[MiG-15]] training [[jet]] crashed.

More information:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yuri_Gagarin

h4. See also

* [[Vostok]]

title: macross_quarter
body:
A fictional [[spacecraft]] from the [[Macross]] [[Science fiction]] series. It appears in the [[Macross Frontier]] TV series from 2008 and was designed by [[Ishigaki Jun'ya]].  

The [b]Macross Quarter Class Variable Space Carrier[/b] is a variable multi-purpose stealth space combat mobile spacecraft carrier that serves as the operational base of the [i]Strategic Military Services[/i] ([[S.M.S.]]) within the Macross Frontier colony fleet. The captain of this ship is [[Jeffrey Wilder]].

Although one-quarter the size of the current Macross Class warships (being equivalent to a 400 meter class vessel typical of regular carriers) the Macross Quarter can transform from a warship (cruiser mode) to [[Storm Attacker]] mode (battle mode) for close combat. The Macross Quarter boasts high mobility and combat performance even though it is the size of a mid-scale warship.

The Macross Quarter is a compound vessel consisting of five warships. The central hull consists of the main body and legs. The forward port side aircraft carrier is designated ARMD-L while the starboard side gunship is designated ARMD-R. The rear starboard-side mobile battery warship is BASTER-R and the rear port side mobile battery warship is BASTER-L. These design mechanisms were aimed at simplifying the transformation. Since each unit carries its own reaction engine and fold engine they can be deployed as independent warships or a fleet. 

The Macross Quarter has the capabilities of an aircraft carrier/amphibious assault spaceship, close-quarter combat capabilities through transformation to storm attack mode and can carry a maximum of 80 variable fighters and Destroids. 

The Gatling-type buster cannon -which can be used as a Heavy Quantum Reaction gun- is suitable for heavy anti-ship combat. In addition to a high output reaction engine cluster, the Macross Quarter has the overall performance worthy of the "Macross" name despite being within the small, 400m class of carriers.

The Macross Frontier fleet's Yaesu Heavy Industries and the L.A.I. Corporation took charge of design and construction of a concept for a "relatively small and excellent maneuverability variable attack space aircraft carrier". 

The Macross Quarter was built in Macross Frontier's dock and when handed over to the S.M.S. upon completion, it was moored to a special pier on Island 1's port side. The vessel functioned as a central command and graveyard facility for the S.M.S. group. 

Originally the Macross Quarter was registered as a "Special Duty Operation Warship" and when incorporated into the New U.N. Spacy it became designated "Small Mobile Combat Aircraft Carrier".

body:
A type of [[spacecraft|space fighter]] in TAITO's video game [[metal_black_(taito)|Metal Black]].
Created to use the same energy beam weapons as its enemy using Newalone particles. Particularly notable is its strange design, in which two ramjet engines are stuck on both sides of its main weapon, particle beam cannon's huge barrel.

title: n.u.n.s.
body:
The [b]New U.N. Spacy[/b] is the name of the successor to the original [[U.N. Spacy]] organization from [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]].

According to the fictional [[Macross]] chronology, since the end of Space War I (2009 A.D. - 2010 A.D.) until the latest animated series, [[Macross Frontier]] (2059 A.D.), the original U.N. Spacy was reorganized into the "New U.N. Spacy" or N.U.N.S.

This new organization functions as a [[space]] [[military]] defense force that is in charge of the protection of all the different colonization fleets of the Human and cultured Zentradi alliance and the [[planet]]s they have colonized across the [[galaxy]]. 

The New U.N. Spacy now has a much bigger space navy composed mostly of military bases established on those planets as well as several defense fleets scattered among the colonization fleets. Each defense fleet is composed mostly of improved Human and [[Zentradi]] capital [[spacecraft]], new variable fighters and other mecha and at least one [[SDF-1]] sized vessel used as command base for the current fleet.

h4. See also

title: william_adama
body:
A main character from the [[Battlestar Galactica]] science fiction TV series from 2004.

He is the [[Commander]] of the titular human [[spacecraft]] of the series.

title: northampton_class_stealth_frigate
body:
A fictional [[spacecraft]] from the [[Macross]] science fiction series.

The [b]Northampton Class Stealth Frigate[/b] is the smallest of the [[U.N. Spacy]] and [[N.U.N.S.]] ships of the line. 

It is an easily constructed wedge shaped small vessel and functions as the main-force warship for colonization fleets. The main engines are built around the center circumference of the rear hull and supply the 250 meter long frigate with excellent speed and maneuverability that compensates for a lack of heavy firepower. 

Like many of the next generation space vessels of the UNG, the stealth frigate features a stealth composition and functions as a carrier ship for variable fighters. In battle the stealth frigate utilizes several concealed launch bays for the fighters and has several anti-ship missile launchers and converging energy beam cannons. 

The widespread use of this class has lead to the deployment of numerous modified frigates such as firepower enhanced, reconnaissance and early warning variants. The stealth frigates have also been adopted by ally [[Zentradi]] crews and these ships feature more giant humanoid [[alien]] technology with distinctive hull designs. The stealth frigate fulfills a primary operational role and thus there are large numbers of these ships serving in the UN Spacy fleets, from planetary defense around Earth  to far reaching colony fleets. 

Stealth Frigates serve as the first defensive line in the migration fleets, with carriers forming the second defense line. Additionally, a squadron of stealth frigates will operate as "pilot fish" for surveying routes and securing supplies ahead of a migration fleets.

This ship was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the 1990s.

title: cosmo_rhino
body:
A fictional [[starfighter]] from the [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato]] [[Science fiction]] TV series.

The [i]Earth Defense Force[/i] [b]Cosmo Rhino[/b] is a type of short range military [[spacecraft]] used mostly for heavy attack missions. It is one of the most heavily armed [[starfighter]]s of the Earth fleet.

This craft is small and slow, but is very well armored and has very powerful weaponry which includes several missiles, space bombs and energy cannons.

title: nupetiet-vergnitzs
body:
A massive [[alien]] [[spacecraft]] from the [[MACROSS]] series.

The [b]Nupetiet-Vergnitzs Class Fleet Command Battleship[/b] was the largest conventional [[Zentradi]] space warship seen during [[choujikuu_yousai_macross|Space War I]]. 

A ship of this type was the lead warship of the [[Boddole Zer]] main fleet's 67th Glruimual class branch [[Vrlitwhai Kridanik|Britai]] (Adoclass) fleet. 

A medium-scale fleet command battleship, the original design for this class of vessel was completed during development competitions in the early years of the Schism War that ocurred in the [[Protoculture]] Stellar Republic thousands of years ago. 

Over 4 km in length, these ships are bristling with numerous particle [[energy cannon]]s and [[missile]] weapon emplacements and carry a large complement of Zentradi [[mecha]].

In [[real life]] the Nupetiet-Vergnitzs was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the early 80s.

title: battle_galaxy
body:
A [[spacecraft]] from the [[Macross]] series. It first appeared in the [[Macross Frontier]] TV series from 2008.

h4. See also

* [[Macross Galaxy]]

title: sidonia_(ship)
body:
A fictional massive [[spacecraft]] from the [[Sidonia No Kishi]] science fiction series.

The [b]Sidonia[/b] spaceship is one of several Seed Ships ([i]Hashu-sen[/i]), a series of gigantic "generation ships":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generation_ship where human people live. It has its own technologically advanced culture and [spoiler]most of its inhabitants are clones and/or genetically modified.[/spoiler] 

Some sections of its outer hull are covered with rocks what gives it an appearance similar to an [[asteroid]] (one of the ends of the ship seems to be embedded into an actual asteroid).

title: daedalus_attack
body:
A tactical maneuver from the [[MACROSS]] [[science_fiction|sci-fi]] series.

It is an attack where the [[SDF-1]] [[Macross]] [[mecha]] [[spacecraft]] uses the [[Daedalus]] [[ship]] (protected by the [[pin-point barrier system]]) as a battering ram while being on [[storm attacker]] mode.

This battle maneuver was invented by the [[U.N. Spacy]] SDF-1 bridge officer [[Hayase Misa]] during [[choujikuu_yousai_macross|Space War I]].

It was called the "Daedalus Maneuver" in [[Robotech]].

title: ghost_(spaceship)
body:
A fictional [[spacecraft]] from the [[Star Wars]] series.

It appears in the [[Star Wars: Rebels]] animated TV series released in 2014.

title: starbase_74
body:
A fictional massive [[space station]] from the [[Star Trek]] series.

[b]Starbase 74[/b] is a huge space station from the [i]United Federation of Planets[/i]. 

The station functions as docking bay and maintenance port for Federation [[spacecraft]].

title: quel-quallie
body:
A fictional [[alien]] [[spacecraft]] from the [[Macross]] series. It first appeared in the [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV series from 1982.

The [b]Boquomouxy Quel-Quallie[/b] is a [[Zentradi]] three-man tactical aerospace reconnaissance [[spacecraft]]. 

Despite being equipped with long range detection and electronic countermeasure systems it is also armed with several energy cannons and internal [[rocket launcher]]s for defense.

It was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the early 80s.

h4. See also

* "Quel-Quallie Image":http://www.macross2.net/m3/sdfmacross/quel-quallie/quel-quallie.gif

title: hyperion_(gin'eiden)
body:
A spaceship of the [[Free Planets Alliance]] in [[Ginga Eiyuu Densetsu]]. One of [[Yang Wen-li]]'s flagships, along with the  [[ulysses_(gin'eiden)|Ulysses]]. The ship is characterised by several [[antennae]] and its pennant number, "144M".

h4.See also

* [[spacecraft]]
* "Gin'eiden Wikia":http://gineipaedia.com/wiki/Hyperion

title: rocket_ship
body:
A tube shaped space vessel with a pointed nose, and usually with stabilization fins and a powerful lift-off engine at the base. Examples include the [[Saturn V]] rocket with a payload, and [[flash gordon (series)|Flash Gordon]]'s spaceship.

h4. See also

* [[spacecraft]]

title: bairal_jin
body: [[Doba Ajiba]]'s I-shaped gigantic [[spacecraft|spaceship]] from [[Densetsu Kyojin Ideon]].

title: planetes
body:
An epic, hard [[science fiction]] manga by [[Yukimura Makoto]]. Later adapted into a 26-episode anime.

[b]Planetes[/b] is the story of a group of space [[trash|garbage]] collectors and their adventures during their mission of cleaning [[Earth (planet)|]]'s orbit of dangerous [[spacecraft]] and [[satellite]] debris.

The series has been praised for its realistic depiction of future [[space]] exploration and the psychological and sociological long terms effects of it.

h4. See also

* [[Arvind Ravy]] 
* [[Edelgard Rivera]] 
* [[Fee Carmichael]]

* [[Philip Myers]]
* [[Tanabe Ai]] 
* [[Yuri Mihairokov]]
* [[Nono (Planetes)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Planetes":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Planetes]

title: x-15
body:
The [B]North American X-15[/B] was a hypersonic rocket-powered [[aircraft]] operated by the United States Air Force and the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (N.A.S.A.) as part of the X-plane series of experimental aircraft. 

The X-15 set speed and altitude records in the 1960s, reaching the edge of outer [[space]] and returning with valuable data used later in aircraft and [[spacecraft]] design. 

The X-15's official world record for the highest speed ever recorded by a manned, powered aircraft, set in October 1967 when William J. "Pete" Knight flew [b]Mach 6.72[/b] at 102,100 feet (31,120 m), a speed of 4,520 miles per hour (7,274 km/h), has remained unchallenged as of May 2017.

title: romulan_warbird
body:
A fictional [[military]] [[alien]] [[spacecraft]] from the [[Star Trek]] series.

The [b]Romulan Warbird[/b] is a heavy armed type of combat spacecraft used by the [[Romulan]] race.

title: mogami_(spaceship)
body:
A large combat [[spacecraft]] from the [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato]] science fiction anime series from the 70s.

The [i]Earth Defense Force[/i] Combat [[Space]] Cruiser [b]Mogami[/b] was [[Okita Juuzou]]'s previous spaceship before the [[Yamato (Uchuu Senkan Yamato)|Yamato]].

This ship also appears in the [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato 2199]] remake, but is now called the [[kirishima_(spaceship)|Kirishima]].

title: jeffrey_wilder
body:
A character from the [[Macross]] series. He appears in the [[Macross Frontier]] series from 2008. 

Jeffrey Wilder is the captain of the [[Macross Quarter]] [[S.M.S.]] [[spacecraft]].

title: frank_poole
body:
A character from the [[2001 A Space Odyssey]] [[Science fiction]] film and novel from the 60s.

Dr. [b]Franklyn "Frank" Poole[/b] is an [[astronaut]] aboard the [[Discovery One]] [[spacecraft]] on the first manned mission to Jupiter (Saturn in the novel).

In the film version he has a yellow [[spacesuit]] and was played by American actor "Gary Lockwood":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gary_Lockwood

title: supervision_army
body:
An ancient [[alien]] [[space]] [[army]] first mentioned in [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] [[mecha]] anime TV series.

They have been enemies of the [[Zentradi]] for millenia and are at the service of the [b]Protodeviln[/b].

The original Supervision Army was created by the Protodeviln by using brainwashed humanoid aliens like Zentradi and [[Meltrandi]] [[maclone]] giants, as well as [[Protoculture]] [[miclone]] normal sized individuals.

The [[SDF-1]] Macross space fortress from [i]Choujikuu Yousai Macross[/i] 80s TV series was originally a Supervision Army [[spacecraft]].

In the [[Macross 7]] 90s TV series a new Supervision Army called the [b]Varauta Army[/b] was created by the re-awakened Protodeviln to fight the Macross 7 fleet. This new hostile space army was composed of brainwashed Humans and Zentradi from the New [[U.N. Spacy]].

h4. See also

*  [[ASS-1]]
*  [[Protodeviln]]
*  [[Varauta]]

title: spaceship_hair_ornament
body: A [[hair ornament]] or [[hairpin]] shaped like a [[spacecraft|spaceship]].

title: fulbtzs-berrentzs
body:
A fictional, super-massive [[alien]] [[spacecraft]] from the [[MACROSS]] series.

The [b]Fulbtzs-Berrentzs Class Mothership[/b] is a [[Zentradi]] vessel so large it is better classified as a small stellar mass than as a spacecraft. It is the colossal mothership of the Spiral Nebula Arm Central Fleet also known as the Boddole Main Fleet. 

At over 1,400 km (870 miles) in height, the Fulbtzs-Berrentzs commands a fleet of millions of Zentradi capital warships. 

Several sets of massive bay doors litter the outside of this gargantuan vessel allowing ships larger than the [[Nupetiet-Vergnitzs]] class to travel dozens of kilometers through the flagship's hull and into the open interior. 

Inside the mothership, thousands of Zentradi warships can be docked and re-supplied. In the center of the open interior lies the main command super-structure, a massive pillar stretching from the bottom to the top of the vessel interior. It is within this spire that the bridge can be found and where Golg [[Boddole Zer]] leads the millions of space warships at his command.

In [[real life]] it was designed by artist [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the early 80s.

title: galactica
body:
A massive human [[military]] [[spacecraft]] from the [[Battlestar Galactica]] science fiction franchise.

The [b]Battlestar Galactica[/b] is the titular spaceship from both the original 1978 TV show and the re-imagined 2004 TV series.

title: battle_frontier
body:
A fictional massive [[spacecraft]] from the [[Macross]] [[Science fiction]] series.

The [b]Battle Frontier[/b] (abbreviated name, [b]Battle 25[/b]) is a [[N.U.N.S.]] variable stealth space attack aircraft carrier connected at the tip of [[Island 1]] and charged with guarding the [[Macross Frontier]] colony convoy. 

Much larger than the [[Macross 7]] Class, the Battle 25 was designed for enhanced fighting strength and command abilities to accomodate the much larger scale of the emigrant fleet and the accompanying naval fleet. These changes resulted in the Battle 25 being built over 200 meters longer than the Battle 7 class (Battle 25 length: 1,681 meters) and the operational weight was doubled to 16,550,000 metric tons.

The Battle Frontier is formed by six ships: two stealth medium space carriers (which function as the arms in attack mode), one Combat Command Carrier ("central block"), two medium assault battleships (functioning as the leg "engine blocks"") and one heavy bombardment warship ("Gunship").

When separated, each ship is fold capable, combat capable and otherwise possesses all capabilities of a space battleship. Although Battle Frontier and [[Battle Galaxy]] are the same type of warship with a common design they differ greatly in interior design and electronic equipment.

It was designed by [[Ishigaki Jun'ya]] from original designs by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]].

title: a.i._(precure)
body: [[Hagoromo Lala]]'s personal artificial intelligence assistant which is loaded onto her [[spacecraft|rocket]].

title: tread
body:
A fictional transformable [[mecha]] from the [[Kikou Souseiki Mospeada]] science fiction series from the 80s.

The [b]AB-01 Tread[/b] heavy mecha is a 3 form heavy armed and heavy armored all-purpose and support variable [[bomber]] designed to be connected with the [[Legioss]].

It has 3 transformation modes: Armo-Soldier ([[Giant]] [[Robot]]), Armo-Bomber (Bomber/Heavy [[Spacecraft]]) and Armo-Diver ([[Gerwalk]]). The Tread can be connected in tandem with the [[Legioss]] mecha.


[b]TR.EA.D.[/b] stands for "[b]TR[/b]ans [b]EA[/b]rth [b]D[/b]eployment heavy transformable fighter".

In [[real life]] it was designed by [[Aramaki Shinji]] in the early 80s.

title: mu_(orguss)
body:
A fictional, hostile [[robot]] race from the [[Choujikuu Seiki Orguss]] [[mecha]] anime [[science fiction]] TV series from the 80s. They are the main antagonists in the show.

The [b]Mu[/b] are a very advanced robotic civilization who possess a massive army of several powerful combat [[spacecraft]], fighter [[aircraft]] and several different [[mecha]].  

h4.See also

* [[Mome (Orguss)]]
* [[Taii]]

title: viper_(spacecraft)
body:
A one-man [[spacecraft]] from the [[Battlestar Galactica]] science fiction franchise.

A type of small aerospace [[starfighter]] used by the human forces during their battles against the [[Cylon]] [[robot]]s in the show.

The [b]Colonial Viper[/b] is very fast, highly maneuverable and also armed with 2 laser cannons in the original series. The 2003 "Re-Imagining" equips them with 30mm autocannons to maintain a more "realistic" aesthetic. Some models can also be modified to carry an additional [[pilot]] or even [[missile]]s and other weaponry.

title: chiram
body:
A fictional humanoid race from the [[Choujikuu Seiki Orguss]] [[mecha]] anime [[science fiction]] TV series from the 1980s.

The [b]Chiram[/b] are an advanced militaristic civilization who possess a massive army of several powerful combat [[spacecraft]], fighter [[aircraft]] and several different mecha.  

Chiram [[soldier]]s usually wear a triangular [[badge]] sticker in their foreheads which has their rank and affiliation printed on it.

The Chiram are actually [spoilers]future Earth humans who evolved into a hi-tech militaristic society.[/spoilers]

h4. Chiram Mecha

* [[Ishfon]]
* [[Ishkick]]
* [[Nikick]]

h4. See also

* [[Athena Henderson]]

title: lord_british
body:
A fictional [[spacecraft]] from the [[Gradius]] science fiction [[video game]] series.

The [b]Lord British[/b] [[starfighter]] -which is sometimes referred as "Road British" due to the ambiguity of Japanese-to-English romanization- is a powerful [[space]] attack craft similar in strength to the famous [[Vic Viper]]. 

It first appeared in the spin-off video game, [[salamander_(game)|Salamander]] from 1986.

title: kodai_mamoru
body:
A character from the [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato]] sci-fi anime series from the 70s. He also appears in the [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato 2199]] remake from 2012.

[b]Kodai Mamoru[/b] is the captain of the [[spacecraft|space destroyer]] "Yuikikaze" and the older brother of [[Kodai Susumu]].

h4. See also

* [[Yukikaze (Spaceship)]]

title: kirishima_(spaceship)
body:
A large [i]Earth Defense Force[/i] combat [[spacecraft]] from the [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato 2199]] science fiction anime series. 

The [b]Kirishima[/b] was [[Okita Juuzou]]'s previous spaceship before the [[Yamato (Uchuu Senkan Yamato)|Yamato]].

h4. See also

* [[Mogami (spaceship)]]
* [[Kirishima (kancolle)|]]

title: andromeda_(uchuu_senkan_yamato)
body:
A fictional [[spacecraft]] from the [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato]] science fiction anime series. It first appeared in the second season of the original anime TV series broadcasted in 1978.

The [b]Earth Defense Force Space Battleship Andromeda[/b] is a very powerful military space craft with a new and advanced design developed from the [[yamato_(uchuu_senkan_yamato)|Space Battleship Yamato]]. However, the Andromeda is better armed and armored, bigger, faster and has two [[Wave Motion Gun]]s instead of one.
other_names: アンドロメダ(宇宙戦艦ヤマト)

title: crusher_joe
body:
A series of [[science fiction]] light novels by "Takachiho Haruka":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Haruka_Takachiho and released by "Asahi Sonorama":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asahi_Sonorama from 1977 to 2013. 

During the late 70s and as one of the founding fathers of Studio Nue, Takachiho decided that besides being a sci-fi designer he would try his hand at penning sci-fi novels. The result was [b][i]Crusher Joe[/i][/b], a [[Star Wars]] inspired story about a group of anti-heroes who were not the typical self-sacrificing types but noble in their own right nonetheless.

Enter the tale of the "Crusher Council", an organization formed by [[spacecraft]] crews known for dangerous assignments ranging from transportation to terraforming and everything in between. In the early days of [[space]] exploration the Crushers took on the job of destroying [[asteroid]]s and defining space lanes. Because of their work, they were nicknamed "Crushers" which eventually became their business moniker.

Crusher Joe was made into an animated film in 1983 and a 2 episode OVA in 1989, both created by [[sunrise_(company)|Sunrise]]. The film version won the Animage Anime Grand Prix prize in 1983. 

[[Kawamori Shouji]] and [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] from Studio Nue (famous for their work in [[Macross]]) made several [[spacecraft]] and [[mecha]] designs for the first film, and these have been used since then in all the manga and anime adaptations of the novels that have been released afterwards. 

h4. See also

* [[Joe_(crusher_joe)|Joe]]
* [[Alfin]]

* [[Jonah Mateur]] (Dr. Mateur)

h4.See also

title: raider_(spacecraft)
body:
A fictional [[spacecraft]] from the [[Battlestar Galactica]] science fiction TV series.

The [b]Cylon Raider[/b] is the main [[Cylon]] aerospace fighter during their war of extermination against the human colonies.

Despite being slow it is heavily armored and armed with laser cannons and missiles. The raider is usually piloted by three [[Cylon Centurion]]s.

title: queadol-magdomilla
body:
A fictional massive [[alien]] [[spacecraft]] from the [[MACROSS]] series. It first appeared in the [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV series from 1982 and also appears in the more recent [[Macross Frontier]] TV series from 2008.

The [b]Queadol-Magdomilla Class Fleet Command Battleship[/b] is a medium scale modular warship, often found in the role of a fleet command ship. 

This spaceship is actually two individual vessels able to be separated to serve different functions.  

The 1.3 km long forward section of the Queadol-Magdomilla (the "Assault Module") can detach from the 1.7 km long main vessel (the "Orbital Module") and act as an aerial assault craft for combat inside a planetary atmosphere. 

This modular system allows the two sections to operate independently and both are heavily armed with multiple beam weapon and missile batteries. It also has several hangar bays carrying large [[mecha]] complements. 

While the orbital module can still enter a planetary atmosphere like most Zentradi warships, that part of the ship has limited maneuverability. 

Although this class has been in use for hundreds of millennia (as has most of the Zentradi fleet) the Queadol-Magdomilla was born in the middle stages of the [[Protoculture]] Stellar Republic's Schism War and is thus one of the newer ships of line.

A ship of this class was used by [[Quamzin Kravshera]] during [[choujikuu_yousai_macross|Space War I]]. His vessel was one of the few Zentradi ships to have a complement of [[Glaug]] mecha in its hangar bays for Quamzin's personal use.

In [[real life]] it was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the early 80s.

title: dave_bowman
body:
A character from the [[2001 A Space Odyssey]] [[Science fiction]] film and novel from the 60s.

Dr. [b]David "Dave" Bowman[/b] is an [[astronaut]] aboard the [[Discovery One]] [[spacecraft]] on the first manned mission to Jupiter (Saturn in the novel).

In the film version he has a red [[spacesuit]] and was played by American actor "Keir Dullea":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keir_Dullea.

title: hayabusa_(spacecraft)
body:
はやぶさ (hayabusa), also known as MUSES-C, is a space probe that the "JAXA":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan_Aerospace_Exploration_Agency developed and it's main purpose was to perform various technological experiments through a mission involving the returning of a sample from an asteroid. 

This [[spacecraft]], while being hit with fatal complications many times over, returned to Earth. This great undertaking gathered social interest, and a "Hayabusa boom", big enough to make three movies, occurred. However, there are many space development fans who fear that this story may impede the improvement of the underlying causes like budgetary deficits. 

The solar paddles arranged in a H-shape, the four ion thrusters, a parabolic high-gain [[radio antenna]] and the re-entry capsule half embedded in the body are this probe's external characteristics. In Hayabusa's fan's artwork, almost always this "wok with a lid"-like shape a capsule is drawn. 

h4.See also 

* [[minerva_(spacecraft)]] / (asteroid rover) 
* [[spacecraft]] 
* [[atmospheric reentry]]

title: sf-3a
body:
A fictional [[starfighter]] from the [[MACROSS]] series. It first appeared in the [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV series from 1982.

The [b]SF-3A Lancer II[/b] is a general purpose manned space fighter designed only for service aboard the space carrier ships of the [[U.N. Spacy]]. Armed with two large energy [[cannon]]s and internal long range [[rocket launcher]]s, the Lancer II is well suited for long distance battles that are typical in [[space]]. 

Despite its high range of operation, impressive weaponry and superior speed, is not very maneuverable, so is better suited for anti-capital ship combat and large [[spacecraft]] defense.

It was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the early 80s.

h4. See also

* "SF-3A Lancer II Image" [s]h[/s][s]ttp://www.macross2.net/m3/sdfmacross/lancerii/lancerii.gif[/s] (Dead link)

title: thrusters
body: Rocket & jet based propulsion systems usually used in [[aircraft]] or [[spacecraft]].

title: macross_cannon
body:
A massive fictional variable military [[spacecraft]] from the [[Macross]] science fiction series. 

The [b]New U.N. Spacy "Macross Cannon Class"[/b] is a transformable [[space]] fortress (and [[mecha]]) from the anime [[Macross 2]] released in the 90s. 

The massive Macross Cannon vessels are heavily armed ships designed for intense anti-ship combat. 

Over 6,000 meters (more than 6500 yards) long, this class of combat vessel is connected to four refurbished [[Nupetiet-Vergnitzs]] [[Zentradi]] battleships. 

Each ship is armed with one heavy converging energy beam "[[SDF-1]] Macross-style" cannon that opens along the horizontal axis to collimate the heavy converging energy beams for use against enemy warships. 

The Macross Cannon ships with their 4 heavy particle cannons are extremely effective vessels for countering massive enemy fleets of warships and their multiple heavy guns allow a single Macross Cannon to destroy multiple ships with one volley.

In real life the ship was designed by mecha anime designer [[Oohata Kouichi]] in the early 90s.

title: pin-point_barrier_system
body:
An energy [[shield]] system from the [[MACROSS]] science fiction universe.

It was shown for the first time in the [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] anime TV series from the early 80s, where it partially protected the [[SDF-1]] Macross [[spacecraft]]. It also was used during the ship's "[[Daedalus Attack]]".

In later Macross productions like [[Macross Plus]], [[Macross 7]] and [[Macross Frontier]] this system has been adapted for [[variable fighter]] use.

title: cosmo_tiger
body:
A fictional [[starfighter]] from the [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato]] [[Science fiction]] TV series.

The [i]Earth Defense Force[/i] [b]Cosmo Tiger[/b] is a type of heavy military [[spacecraft]] used mostly for attack and combat missions. It was developed as an hybrid from both the original [[black_tiger_(yamato)|Black Tiger]] and the Cosmo Zero spacecraft.

It is not as fast as the [[Cosmo Zero]], but is better armored and has more powerful weaponry. It is also equipped with an omni-directional laser turret for self-defense as well as powerful sensor arrays which enable the craft to be used effectively as a long range armed reconnaissance vessel.

body: A [[spacecraft]] featured in [i][[Among Us]][/i].

[[NASA]]'s [[pluto_(planet)|Pluto]] probe that was launched in 2006.

* [[spacecraft]]
* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Horizons#Mission_profile]
other_names: ニュー・ホライズンズ

title: jetfire
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Jetfire[/b] is a heroic [[Autobot]], a sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a red and white combat [[spacecraft]].

In [[Japan]] and in the first TV series his name was changed to [b]Skyfire[/b] (スカイファイアー). He used to be [[Starscream]]'s best friend in the past.

Jetfire's first American toy was a conversion of the original [[VF-1 Super]] Valkyrie [[mecha]] from [[MACROSS]] (created by [[Kawamori Shouji]] in the early 80s).

In the live action films he is an old robot warrior that transforms into an [[sr-71_blackbird|SR-71]] [[jet]]. In the movies he used to be a [[Decepticon]], but eventually got tired of being one and decided to side with the Autobots.

Motto: [i]"Among mysteries of science lies the key to victory...".[/i]
other_names: ドレッドロック(ギャラクシーフォース)
