title: rhinedottir_(genshin_impact)
body:
Rhinedottir, also known as "Gold," is a researcher from Khaenri'ah in [[Genshin Impact]] and practitioner of the Art of Khemia. She is best known for her masterpieces, [[Durin (genshin impact)|]] and [[Albedo (genshin impact)|]]. As "Gold," she is also called the "Great Sinner."

Although her official appearance is yet to be revealed, fans frequently feature her in art alongside Albedo.

title: table_tennis
body:
Table tennis, also known as ping-pong, is a sport in which two or four players hit a lightweight ball, also known as the ping-pong ball, back and forth across a table using small rackets.  A common feature depicted in [[ryokan|traditional Japanese inns]].

body:

body:

title: lacrosse
body:
A full contact team sport played using a solid rubber ball and long handled racket called a crosse or lacrosse stick. The head of the crosse has a loose net strung into it that allows the player to hold the lacrosse ball.

* [[Playing sports]]
* [[Tag Group:Sports]]

title: vuvuzela
body:
A [[horn (instrument)|]] commonly blown by [[playing sports|sports]] fans, it was largely present at [[2010 FIFA World Cup]] in South Africa. Well known for its distinctive, extremely loud, sustained bzzz-sound especially when used en-masse. This caused them to be hated by both referees and fans as it covered the whistle's sound, interrupting the game.

title: skydive
body:
The act or sport of jumping out of an [[aircraft]] in flight with intent to free fall before using a [[parachute]] to land safely.

Distinct from BASE jumping, which is parachuting from a [b]b[/b]uilding, [b]a[/b]ntenna, [b]s[/b]pan (bridge), [b]e[/b]arth feature, or anything else physically connected to the ground.

It was originated/influenced by the Chinese sport "Cuju":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cuju].
There is a theory that the [[temari ball]] derived from deerskin leather mari balls used for the kemari.

title: botan_(kof)
body:
牡丹

A character from SNK's [[The King of Fighters]] series of video games.

Botan is a member of the group known as Those from the Past. She appeared in 2003, alongside [[Mukai (KOF)|Mukai]] at the end of the tournament. She was controlling Kagura Chizuru and made her create a copy of her sister, Maki. She and Mukai broke the Orochi seal through Chizuru and they are hoping to give the Orochi power to their unknown master.
 
In The King of Fighters XI, she controlled [[Rose Bernstein]] and ordered her to create the tournament, so [[Magaki (KOF)|Magaki]] could put his plans in motion. She apparently carries orders from her masters to [[Ash Crimson]], but he doesn't take her too seriously.
 
In The King of Fighters XIII, she serves Saiki faithfully, but makes the mistake of standing too closely to Ash when Saiki possesses him, and is blown away by the resulting energy surge. In the ending to the Story Mode she is seen walking in a crowd, confirming she survived.

Ban Mai always wears a cat-eared headset to broadcast radar to detect the signals of the forces of darkness. It sounds great, but in reality it's just... she claims to be. She is just a 15 years old chuuni girl!

title: the_world_(tarot)
body:
The twenty-first of the Major Arcana cards in a [[tarot]] deck.

The World is traditionally represented by a woman [[floating|hovering]] above the Earth, with a [[wand]] in each hand, surrounded by a [[wreath]]. In many decks, The World has four creatures watching from its corners: an [[eagle]], a [[lion]], an [[bull|ox]], and a human.

h4.See also

* [[tarot]]
* [[Tag Group:Cards]]

title: judgement_(tarot)
body:
The twentieth of the Major Arcana cards in a [[tarot]] deck.

Judgement is represented by an [[angel]] blowing a [[horn_(instrument)|horn]] as the dead [[resurrection|rise from their graves]].

h4.See also

* [[tarot]]
* [[Tag Group:Cards]]

title: the_sun_(tarot)
body:
The nineteenth of the Major Arcana cards in a [[tarot]] deck.

The Sun is depicted as a (usually human-faced) [[sun_symbol|sun]]. Naked children and [[sunflower|sunflowers]] may be present.

h4.See also

* [[tarot]]
* [[Tag Group:Cards]]

title: the_moon_(tarot)
body:
The eighteenth of the Major Arcana cards in a [[tarot]] deck.

The Moon is traditionally depicted by a night scene in which a [[dog]] and a [[wolf]] howl at the [[full moon]] while a [[lobster]] reaches up from the water.

h4.See also

* [[tarot]]
* [[Tag Group:Cards]]

title: your_tie_is_crooked
body: Famous scene from [[Maria-sama ga Miteru]].
other_names: タイが曲がっていてよ

title: the_tower_(tarot)
body:
The sixteenth of the Major Arcana cards in a [[tarot]] deck.

The Tower, in most decks, is represented by a [[tower]] being [[destruction|destroyed]]. It may be struck by [[lightning]] or crumbling due to some other destructive force.

h4.See also

* [[tarot]]
* [[Tag Group:Cards]]

title: the_devil_(tarot)
body:
The fifteenth of the Major Arcana cards in a [[tarot]] deck.

The Devil traditionally takes the form of a [[demon|demonic]] figure, usually with mixed human and bestial features. In some decks, the Devil stands or squats atop a pedestal to which nude male and female humanoid demons are chained.

h4.See also

* [[tarot]]
* [[Tag Group:Cards]]

title: temperance_(tarot)
body:
The fourteenth of the Major Arcana cards in a [[tarot]] deck.

Temperance is represented by an [[angel]] or human [[pouring]] liquid from one vessel into another. In some decks, they are standing with one foot in water and the other on land.

h4.See also

* [[tarot]]
* [[Tag Group:Cards]]

title: death_(tarot)
body:
The thirteenth of the Major Arcana cards in a [[tarot]] deck.

Death is traditionally represented by a [[skeleton|skeletal]] figure, often carrying a [[scythe]] like the classic [[Grim Reaper]]. In some decks, Death rides a horse and carries a black [[flag|standard]] with a white rose.

h4.See also

* [[death (entity)]]
* [[tarot]]
* [[Tag Group:Cards]]

title: the_hanged_man_(tarot)
body:
The twelfth of the Major Arcana cards in a [[tarot]] deck.

The Hanged Man is almost always a figure suspended [[upside-down]] by one ankle, usually with the other leg bent to resemble the numeral 4. Despite their situation, they typically have a [[expressionless|calm or stoic]] facial expression.

h4.See also

* [[hanged]]
* [[tarot]]
* [[Tag Group:Cards]]

title: louise_halevy
body: Louise Halevy is a character from [[Gundam 00]], the classmate and girlfriend of [[Saji Crossroad]].

title: justice_(tarot)
body:
Depending on the deck, Justice is either the eighth or the eleventh of the Major Arcana cards in a [[tarot]] deck.

Justice is traditionally represented by a figure wielding a [[sword]] in one hand and holding a [[balance scale]] in the other. They may be wearing a [[crown]].

h4.See also

* [[tarot]]
* [[Tag Group:Cards]]

title: wheel_of_fortune_(tarot)
body:
The tenth of the Major Arcana cards in a [[tarot]] deck.

The Wheel of Fortune is a many-spoked [[wheel]] that traditionally "symbolizes":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rota_Fortunae luck or fate. The wheel often has one or more characters riding or climbing it.

h4.See also

* [[tarot]]
* [[Tag Group:Cards]]

title: the_lovers_(tarot)
body:
The sixth of the Major Arcana cards in a [[tarot]] deck.

The Lovers is traditionally a [[nude]] [[couple]], sometimes with an [[angel]] or deity watching over them.

h4.See also

* [[tarot]]
* [[Tag Group:Cards]]

title: the_hermit_(tarot)
body:
The ninth of the Major Arcana cards in a [[tarot]] deck.

The Hermit is a hooded figure, typically an [[old man]], carrying a lit [[lantern]] and a [[staff]].

h4.See also

* [[tarot]]
* [[Tag Group:Cards]]

title: strength_(tarot)
body:
Depending on the deck, Strength is either the eighth or the eleventh of the Major Arcana cards in a [[tarot]] deck.

Strength is typically depicted as a woman taming a [[lion]], either by holding its jaws shut or sitting on it.

h4.See also

* [[tarot]]
* [[Tag Group:Cards]]

title: the_chariot_(tarot)
body:
The seventh of the Major Arcana cards in a [[tarot]] deck.

The Chariot is represented by a character driving a [[chariot]] pulled by two or more animals, traditionally black and white [[horse|horses]] or [[sphinx|sphinxes]]. The character driving the chariot may wield a [[sword]] or [[wand]].

h4.See also

* [[tarot]]
* [[Tag Group:Cards]]

title: the_hierophant_(tarot)
body:
The fifth of the Major Arcana cards in a [[tarot]] deck.

The Hierophant is usually drawn in religious garb with a [[mitre]] and holding a triple [[cross]], traditionally associated with the [[pope]]. Symbolic depictions of the Hierophant show him on a [[throne]] between two pillars, with worshipers at his feet.

h4.See also

* [[tarot]]
* [[Tag Group:Cards]]

title: the_emperor_(tarot)
body:
The fourth of the Major Arcana cards in a [[tarot]] deck.

The Emperor wears a [[crown]] and sits on a [[throne]] decorated with [[sheep|rams']] heads. He may be holding a [[scepter]] and/or a [[globe]].

h4.See also

* [[tarot]]
* [[Tag Group:Cards]]

title: the_empress_(tarot)
body:
The third of the Major Arcana cards in a [[tarot]] deck.

The Empress is traditionally a woman seated on a [[throne]], wearing a monarch's [[crown]] and holding a [[scepter]]. In many decks, the Empress is [[pregnant]]. Her throne may be situated in a [[field]] of grain or lush vegetation.

h4.See also

* [[tarot]]
* [[Tag Group:Cards]]

title: the_high_priestess_(tarot)
body:
The second of the Major Arcana cards in a [[tarot]] deck.

In older tarot decks designed for card games, the High Priestess is [i]La Papesse[/i], a female [[pope]]. Occult tarot decks surround the High Priestess with esoteric symbolism; she wears a crown like that of the goddess [[hathor_(mythology)|Hathor]], she sits between "two pillars labeled B and J":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boaz_and_Jachin, she holds a [[book]] or [[scroll]], and the [[moon]] is at her feet.

h4.See also

* [[tarot]]
* [[Tag Group:Cards]]

title: cinderella_(grimm)
body: The main heroine of [[Cinderella]], a folk tale where she has to work as a scullery maid for her wicked stepmother and two stepsisters. One night, her life changes when her fairy godmother uses magic to transform her clothes into a beautiful ball gown so she can attend a ball being held to select a bride for the kingdom's prince. The stipulation is that the magic will wear out at midnight. Cinderella meets the prince and he is enamored by her beauty, but she must suddenly leave at midnight. She accidentally leaves a [[glass slipper]] for the prince to use as a means of finding her again. When the slipper fits Cinderella's foot, she and the prince are married happily ever after.

title: antonio_salieri_(first_ascension)_(fate)
body: [[Antonio Salieri (fate)|]] in his First Ascension costume from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. This is a set of black-and-red armor and clothing that covers his entire body, and he wears an additional silver mask over the helmet. For the more monstrous version of this armor, see his [[antonio salieri (third ascension) (fate)|Third Ascension]] tag.

title: antonio_salieri_(third_ascension)_(fate)

It's the same as his [[antonio salieri (first ascension) (fate)|First Ascension]] armor, but this version is more monstrous and deformed. His gloves gain long steel claws, his mask becomes a mouth with jagged teeth, and small eye-like purple lights emanate from his horn-like mask.

title: super_mecha_champions
body:
Super Mecha Champions (also known as Mobile City X) is a third-person [[mecha]] battle royale game developed by NetEase for smartphones, and later ported to PC for Steam. 

The game is set in Alpha City, the location of the Super Mecha League, a championship where ace pilots from around the world and their representative mecha gather to battle for the top.

h1. Characters
[b]Pilots / Mecha[/b]
* [[Cyrus (smc)|]] / [[Trio of Enders]]
* [[Iori (smc)|]] / [[Skylark (smc)|]]
* [[Ivan (smc)|]] / [[Hotsteel (smc)|]]
* [[Jaka (smc)|]] / [[Northern Knight (smc)|]]
* [[Jiu Chong (smc)|]] / [[Ventorus (smc)|]]
* [[Joanna (smc)|]] / [[Andromeda (smc)|]]
* [[Lan Xin (smc)|]] / [[Pulsar (smc)|]]
* [[Lillian (smc)|]] / [[Neutron Star (smc)|]]
* [[Mila (smc)|]] / [[Caramel (smc)|]]
* [[Mobius (smc)|]] / [[Michael (smc)|]]
* [[Nighthawk (smc)|]] / [[Raven (smc)|]]
* [[Ning (smc)|]] / [[Firefox (smc)|]]
* [[Norma (smc)|]] / [[Boltus (smc)|]]
* [[R.E.D (smc)|]] / [[Firestar (smc)|]]
* [[Rom (smc)|]] / [[Arthur (smc)|]]
* [[Serena (smc)|]] / [[Alborada (smc)|]]

title: rust_(programming_language)
body:
Rust is a programming language designed for safety and performance, often compared to C++.

Rust is well known to be unusually strict (compared to other programming languages) on how you are allowed to write your code. This makes the language harder to learn, though many agree it leads to much fewer errors popping up unexpectedly while your program is running.

Rust also has a notion of what is considered [b]safe[/b] and [b]unsafe[/b] code. Usually all rust code is considered safe. But if you put any code inside an unsafe block ([code]unsafe { some code here }[/code]) many of the strict rules of rust are ignored, which makes this code be considered unsafe. Unsafe code is necessary when doing things that safe rust do not support (like calling code from other programming languages).
Some argue that this makes fatal errors easier to find (compared to other languages) since they are almost always found inside unsafe code.

h4. See also
* [b]Official webpage:[/b] https://www.rust-lang.org/
* [b]Maskot:[/b] [[ferris (rust)]]
* [b]Maskot:[/b] [[corro (rust)]]

title: corro_(rust)
body:
Corro the Unsafe Rusturchin. Corro is an unofficial mascot side-character of the Rust Programming Language.

Corro represent what is called unsafe code in rust (see: [[rust (programming language)]]).

h4. See also
* [b]Rust:[/b] [[rust (programming language)]]
* [b]Other mascot:[/b] [[ferris (rust)]]
* [b]Webpage with images:[/b] https://rustacean.net/
* [b]Corro used in learning material:[/b] https://www.lurklurk.org/effective-rust/#ferris

title: admiral_suwabe
body:
An [[abyssal admiral (kancolle)|abyssal admiral]] created by [[k-suwabe]]. Has [[white skin]], a [[mustache]], a [[goatee]], and [[dreadlocks]].

Surprisingly, he has a kind and fatherly personality, despite being an [[abyssal ship]]. Nonetheless, he does his best leading his fleet of misfits into battle against his rival, the Kanmusu Fleet.

If you come across him on the high seas, chances are that he'll be on a wooden rowboat.

His secretary ship is [[ru-class_battleship|Ru-class]].

body:

Simipour is a simian Pokémon that is primarily blue. Its ears are broad with light blue insides, and it has oval eyes and a small black nose. There are several tufts of fur on its head, which resemble [[dreadlocks]]. 

It evolves from [[Panpour]] with a [i]Water Stone[/i].
Japanese Name: [b]Hiyakkie[/b]

title: akkordolia
body:
The akkordolia is a zither from Germany and Austria, consisting of a long box, with the strings being pressed against the fretboard by pressing down buttons from above, similar to the Japanese taishogoto. One row of buttons changes the melody, and the other row of buttons can change the chord which backs the melody.

The instrument was invented around the start of the 20th century[citation needed] by Otto Teller of Klingenthal, Germany, and was produced locally there by cottage industry.

title: help:hash_syntax
body:
URL search parameters after the "?" in a URL form the overall hash structure of the JSON object "[1]":[#dtext-external-links] sent to the server.

h4#key-value. Key/value

Keys and values form a pair as a way to reference data. Each key/value pair in the search parameters is separated by an "&". The key is the text value to the left of the "=", and the "value" is the text value to the right of the "=" and may be "%" URL encoded "[2]":[#dtext-external-links].

h6.URL parameters

[code]
limit=100&page=1
[/code]

h6.JSON object

[code]
{
    "limit": 100,
    "page": 1
}
[/code]

h4#sub-hash. Sub-hash

Sub-hashes are supported by using square brackets "[ ]". The text value inside the square brackets is the sub key that the value will be added to.

h5.Single-level example

h6.URL parameters

[code]
search[name]=test&search[order]=id&limit=20
[/code]

h6.JSON object

[code]
{
    "search": {
        "name": "test",
        "order": "id",
    },
    "limit": 20
}
[/code]

h5.Multi-level example

Sub-hashes can form deeper sub-hashes by stacking the "[ ]" terms in a row.

h6.URL parameters

[code]
search[user][id]=1
[/code]

h6.JSON object

[code]
{
    "search": {
        "user": {
            "id": 1
        }
    }
}
[/code]

h4#array. Array

Arrays can be sent by appending an empty "[]" at the end of the final specifier for the key.

h5.Single-item example

h6.URL parameters

[code]
search[name][]=test
[/code]

h6.JSON object

[code]
{
    "search": {
        "name": ["test"]
    }
}
[/code]

h5.Multi-item example

Multiple array items are sent by using the exact same key for each value in the array.

h6.URL parameters

[code]
search[id][]=1&search[id][]=2
[/code]

h6.JSON object

[code]
{
    "search": {
        "id": [1, 2]
    }
}
[/code]

h5#array-of-files. Array of files

When sending an array of files, the parameter follows a similar format, although it is treated like a hash, where each key of the hash is the index of the file in the array, starting with 0. Since files require a multi-part format, it will look like something similar to the following.

[code]
--9cab1cceecb6c4f5634bcba0e89ee77c
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="upload[files][0]"; filename="6fe571c9df2912b1ae551045c2157240.jpg"
Content-Type: image/jpeg

<FILE DATA>
[/code]

h4. See also

* [[Help:Array syntax]]
* [[Help:Chaining syntax]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[1] https://www.w3resource.com/JSON/structures.php
[2] https://www.w3schools.com/tags/ref_urlencode.ASP

title: paresthesia
body:
An abnormal sensation of the skin (tingling, pricking, chilling, burning, numbness) with no apparent physical cause. It happens when sustained pressure is placed on a nerve (from [[seiza|sitting with legs crossed for too long]], or [[arm_pillow|fallen asleep with an arm crooked under their head]]...) . The feeling quickly goes away once the pressure is relieved.

Also known in English as "[body part] falling asleep" or "pins and needles".
